Leslie, The United Nations Association of the United States of America, 2004 edition (October 2004), softcover, 296 pages, {{ISBN|1-880632-71-3}}. * ''[https://www.munplanet.com/articles/munplanet/munplanet-ebook-becoming-a-model-un-delegate-an-essential-guide-through-the-mun-world Becoming a Model UN Delegate - An Essential Guide Through the MUN World]'', edited by Marko Kovacevic of MUNPlanet (August 2016) * ''[https://www.munplanet.com/articles/organizing-mun/munplanet-ebook-organizing-successful-model-un-conference-download Organizing Successful MUNs - practices, trends, innovation]'', edited by Marko Kovacevic of MUNPlanet (2015) * ''[http://www.engagingtheun.com Engaging the United Nations: A Brief Introduction to the UN]''. Brian Dille. Engagement Learning. 2017. {{ISBN|9780998851808}}
== Model UN by region and country == {{Main article|List of Model United Nations conferences}} Although Model United Nations originated in the United States, MUN clubs and conferences are not isolated to that country. Rather, like the actual UN, Model UN is found in countries around the globe.<ref name="bestdelegate.com">{{cite web|url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-un-conferences-database/|title=Model United Nations Conference Database: 2014-2015|work=bestdelegate.com}}</ref> Because Model UN is decentralized and has grown autonomously around the world, there are significant differences in how MUN is done between regions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bestdelegate.com/a-tale-of-two-coasts-5-key-differences-between-west-coast-versus-east-coast-model-un/|title=A Tale of Two Coasts: 5 Key Differences Between West Coast versus East Coast Model UN|work=Best Delegate}}</ref>
===Denmark===
MUN is relatively popular in Denmark, with conferences at both [[Gymnasium (school)|high-school]] and university level. It was first introduced in 2003,<ref name=EGMUN>{{cite web|title=Previous MUNs|url=http://egmun.org/previous-muns/|website=egmun.org|accessdate=24 February 2016}}</ref> it has since spread with 3 major conferences at high-school level, with at least 400 participants at each conference,<ref name=EGMUN /><ref>{{cite web|title=Welcome 2016|url=https://www.facebook.com/bigmunconference/photos/a.635001486565559.1073741825.354614017937642/1023540374378333/?type=3&theater|website=Facebook.com|publisher=BIGMUN|accessdate=24 February 2016}}</ref> with BIGMUN being the largest conference in Scandinavia.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Menzer|first1=Joram Gregers|title=Tomorrow's problem solvers are ready|url=http://sn.dk/Rudersdal/Morgendagens-problemloesere-sidder-klar/artikel/556049|website=sn.dk|accessdate=29 February 2016|language=Danish}}</ref>
=== Spain === MUN has become popular in Spain at the beginning of this decade, hosting the largest number of Conferences in Madrid. One of them is the [https://compimun.com/ Complutense International Model of United Nations (COMPIMUN)], that will include for its third edition other international organisations such as the [[Asia Cooperation Dialogue]], or the [[September 11 attacks|9-11]], apart from the traditional UN related Committees.
=== The Netherlands ===
The largest MUN in the Netherlands is The Hague International Model United Nations (THIMUN) conference, which includes over 3500 participants coming from around 200 schools and 100 different countries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thimun.org/9-features/2-thimun-conference|title=THIMUN Conference The Hague|publisher=THIMUN Foundation|accessdate=1 December 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131006070307/http://www.thimun.org/9-features/2-thimun-conference|archivedate=6 October 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Although it is not located near the United-Nations Headquarters in New-York, it is one of the pioneer Model United Nations conferences in the world, since it has been founded in 1968 and located in the International Court of Justice's (ICJ) world city of the Hague. A whole network of conferences is marked by its THIMUN affiliation, a label which basically describes the universality of the procedures that rule the conference and make it part of the UN recognized foundation. In 1995 the THIMUN Foundation was accredited as a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO) associated with the United Nations Department of Public Information.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thimun.org/index.php/youth-in-action|title=Youth In Action|publisher=THIMUN Foundation|accessdate=1 December 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208134107/http://www.thimun.org/index.php/youth-in-action|archive-date=8 December 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Also, the THIMUN has established its own conferences' network throughout time: THIMUN Qatar, THIMUN Singapore, THIMUN Online MUN (O-MUN) and THIMUN Latin America conferences have been set up from 2005.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thimun.org/index.php/about/thimun-history|title=THIMUN History|publisher=THIMUN Foundation|accessdate=1 December 2015}}</ref> The second and third biggest MUN-conferences of the Netherlands are MUNISH (Model United Nations at the International School of the Hague and HMUN (Haarlem Model United Nations). There is also The European International Model UN TEIMUN which is founded in 1987 and is the oldest university Model UN in Europe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teimun.org|title=The European International Model UN website}}</ref>
=== Turkey === {{Primary sources|date=May 2018}}
In Turkey, Model United Nations conferences are mostly held by non-profit university-clubs. [[Istanbul]] hosts more conferences than all Turkish other cities combined. Yeditepe Model United Nations Club, the oldest and one of the most popular clubs in Turkey, holds three different conferences, being, Yeditepe Model United Nations Training and Development [http://www.y-mun.org Conference], Justinianus Moot [http://www.justinianusmootcourts.org Courts], and Model United Nations Conference Istanbul (MUNIST)[http://munist2017.org]. Also, Koç University Model United Nations Conference (KUMUN)[http://kumun.ku.edu.tr], Kadir Has University Model United Nations Conference (HASMUN)[http://hasmun.org], alongside with the training conference of the Kadir Has University Model United Nations Training Conference (HASTRAIN), Izmir University of Economics Model United Nations Conference (ECOMUN)[https://web.archive.org/web/20170809233018/http://ecomun2017.org/], alongside with the training conference, İzmir University of Economics Training Conference (EcoTRAIN) are most qualified conferences in Turkey. These conferences simulate not only General Assembly committees, but also Joint Crisis Cabinets, Futuristic, Fictional and Historical timeline based committees.
=== United Kingdom ===
There are a very large number of Model United Nations conferences on both the University and Sixth Form level in the United Kingdom. Almost every university that has an MUN society holds a yearly conference, of varying size, with the largest and most prestigious being [[London International Model United Nations]] - so much so a features film was shot about it ([[Winning London]]), followed by [[CUIMUN]] hosted in Cambridge and [[OxiMUN]] in Oxford, however in recent years conferences such as [[YorkMUN]] and [[ScotMUN]] in Edinburgh have been gaining popularity amongst UK delegations. The UK MUN circuit is not particularly well integrated with the European circuit, with most UK delegations not crossing international borders to get to their conferences and international delegations to UK conferences outside of the big three a rarity, but recently European conferences have begun to recruit chairing staff quite heavily from the UK.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
=== Asia-Pacific ===
==== Afghanistan ==== The Kabul Model United Nations was established in [[Kabul]] in 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tolonews.com/afghanistan/hamid-karzai-attacks-un-and-usa |title=Hamid Karzai Attacks UN and USA|author=Nabila Ashrafi |date=9 March 2017 |website=ToloNews |accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref><ref name="MUN Kabul">{{cite web |url=http://munfinder.com/mun/kabul-model-united-nations/ |title=Kabul Model United Nations |website=MUN Finder |accessdate=12 March 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160915115020/http://munfinder.com/mun/kabul-model-united-nations/ |archive-date=15 September 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The objectives are to bring young female and male individuals together to discuss [[global issue]]s and promote diplomacy, human rights, peace building, and social welfare.<ref name="MUN Kabul" /> Participants include university students up to the age of 30. They come from four or five Afghanistan provinces to develop critical thinking and public speaking skills.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://researchfunding.duke.edu/model-united-nations-conference-kabul-deadline-extended |title=Model United Nations Conference in Kabul -- Deadline Extended | author= |date= |website=Duke University - Research Funding |accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref> Pamir International Model United Nations (PIMUN) was established by October 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://sputniknews.com/asia/201608101044130808-afghanistan-un-model/ |title=United Nations Afghani-Style: Country Gets Its Own UN-Like Organization |date=8 October 2016 |website=Sputnik News |accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref>
==== Australia ==== Model United Nations conferences in Australia are typically separated into tertiary and high school levels. At the high school level, the large majority of Model United Nations events are organised by the various state and territory branches of UN Youth Australia,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://unyouth.org.au/event/the-evatt-competition/|title=The Evatt Competition|work=UN Youth Australia|accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> or by the many branches of Rotary Australia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rotarynews.info/3/Club/76641/7833/ |title=Model United Nations Assembly (MUNA) : Rotary E-Club of Greater Sydney |publisher=Rotarynews.info |date=21 April 2014 |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> Tertiary events, typically running for three to four days, occur within several Australian states, and are timed to coincide with holiday periods in tertiary semesters, with the largest three typically being VicMUN, NCMUN and SydMUN. Since 2013 another event was initiated globally in rotary world: [http://rotaractmun.org Rotaract Global Model United Nations] - international youth conference that already traveled from Baia Mare to London, Belgrade, New York, Sofia, Beirut and is set to take place in 2018 in Lithuania and India.
==== Bangladesh ==== {{Main article|Model United Nations in Bangladesh}} Model United Nations is practiced in [[Bangladesh]] since 2002. The first MUN to take place was the Model United Nations on Combating Terrorism - [[BANMUN|Bangladesh Model United Nations]] 2002.<ref>{{citation|url=http://unysab.org/?page_id=584|title=First Model United Nations: UNYSAB|first=|last=|publisher=‘‘UNYSAB’’|date=October 2013|accessdate=14 August 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150825233629/http://unysab.org/?page_id=584|archivedate=25 August 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{citation |url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/arts-culture/2015/aug/11/leaping-over-boundaries|title=Leaping over boundaries |first= |last= |publisher= [[Dhaka Tribune]]|date=11 August 2015 |accessdate=15 August 2015}}</ref> Since then, plenty of Model United Nations conferencess have been held in the country. But the concept of MUN became a popular one in [[Bangladesh]] from 2013.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/education/2013/nov/16/creating-future|title=Creating the future |first= |last= |publisher= [[Dhaka Tribune]]|date=16 November 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2015}}</ref>
United Nations Youth and Students Association of Bangladesh (UNYSAB) established MUN in Bangladesh. [[Bangladesh Model United Nations]] conferences include: Bangladesh International Model United Nations 2012; Dhaka+20, Brainwiz MUN 2013 and UNYSAB MUN 2014, organized by UNYSAB. Conferences of much larger numbers were organized by UNYSAB when they organized Bangladesh Model United Nations (BANMUN) Session VII in June 2015 with more than 560 delegates <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.banmun.com |accessdate=10 January 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160109102930/http://banmun.com/ |archivedate=9 January 2016 }}</ref> and Bangladesh International Model United Nations (BIMUN) Session II in November 2015, with over 850 delegates, the largest number in Bangladesh's history.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bimun.net|title=WELCOME TO BiMUN 2015|website=Bimun.net|accessdate=22 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160202160300/http://bimun.net/|archive-date=2 February 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
MUN in Bangladesh grew rapidly after the formation of the first university based MUN club of the country [[Dhaka University]] Model United Nations Association in 2011.{{cn|date=May 2018}} Dhaka University National Model United Nations (DUNMUN) started from 2012.<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/education/2014/dec/22/dunmun-2014-begins-dhaka-university|title=DUNMUN 2014 begins at Dhaka University|first=|last=|publisher=[[Dhaka Tribune]]|date=22 December 2014|accessdate=15 August 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923225203/http://www.dhakatribune.com/education/2014/dec/22/dunmun-2014-begins-dhaka-university|archive-date=23 September 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{citation |url=http://bestdelegate.com/dhaka-university-national-model-united-nations-empowering-youths|title=Dhaka University National Model United Nations: Empowering Youths |first= |last= |publisher= BestDelegate.com|date=25 January 2015 |accessdate=15 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{citation |url=http://www.newstoday.com.bd/index.php?option=details&news_id=2356844&date=2013-09-18|title=DUNMUN begins at DU |first= |last= |publisher= The News Today|date=18 September 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2015}}</ref> Worlds largest Model UN brand from India, Indian International Model United Nations is also slated to conduct its chapter conference in Dhaka in February 2016.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
==== China ==== Model United Nations first came to China in 1995, when the elite [[China Foreign Affairs University]] held the country's first collegiate Model United Nations conferences.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://oversea.cnki.net/kcms/detail/detail.aspx?filename=WJXY503.015&DBName=cjfqtotal&dbcode=cjfq|title = 记外交学院首届模拟联合国活动 - China Academic Journals Full-text Database|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/special/2013-04/25/c_132339467.htm |title=Intro to CFAU-MUNA - Xinhua | English.news.cn |website=News.xinhuanet.com |date=25 April 2013 |accessdate=22 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509164033/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/special/2013-04/25/c_132339467.htm |archive-date=9 May 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://zqb.cyol.com/html/2012-04/21/nw.D110000zgqnb_20120421_4-04.htm|title = 外交学院举办"2012北京模拟联合国大会"|date = |accessdate =22 January 2016 |website =Zqb.cyol.com |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> Arriving in Chinese high schools in 2005, Model UN expanded rapidly. [[Peking University|Peking University (PKU)]] students, after attending [[Harvard College|Harvard]]'s [[Harvard Model United Nations|HMUN]], organized the first national Model UN conference for high school students in China. PKU's conference was initially backed by [[United Nations Association of the United States of America|UNA-USA]], however support was curtailed in 2010 due to the [[Great Recession]].
Between 2005 and 2010, national Model United Nations conferencess such as those organized by PKU and the rivaling Fudan University in Shanghai drew the best high school students from around the country, who competed for limited spaces. Over time, lesser-known national conferences, as well as regional and even local conferences for high school students, began to develop and gradually spread to cities beyond [[Beijing]] and [[Shanghai]].<ref name="theatlantic.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/china/archive/2013/04/romance-money-intrigue-its-model-un-in-china/275308/2/|title=Romance! Money! Intrigue! It's Model UN ... in China|first=Wendy|last=Qian|date=25 April 2013|work=The Atlantic}}</ref>
In the realm of interscholastic Model United Nations conferencess in China, the widely acknowledged{{According to whom|date=May 2018}} top 3 conferences are called "the ABC": [[Asian International Model United Nations]] held by [[Peking University]]; [http://www.bimun.org.cn/en/ Beijing International Model United Nations] held by [[China Foreign Affairs University]], and [[China National Model United Nations]], held by [[United Nations Association of China]], hosted in different cities annually. Another famous conference is the Annual NEOMUN conference, also known as SCAMUN by internal members.<ref>{{cite news|title=模拟联合国(MUN)简介|url=http://www.unachina.org/upload/Attach/default/272497.doc|publisher=U.N. Association of China|date=23 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150115050959/http://www.unachina.org/upload/Attach/default/272497.doc|archivedate=15 January 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Most Model United Nations conferences in China are organized through private or academic enterprises, however some government-affiliated MUNs have also flourished, and recently, unofficial student-run grassroots conferences have begun to dominate the Chinese MUN scene.<ref name="theatlantic.com"/>
==== India ==== {{Primary|section|date=June 2018}} In 1996, the Cathedral Model United Nations was hosted by The Cathedral and John Connon School in Mumbai.{{citation needed|date=June 2017}} Since then, schools and colleges in India started taking up Model United Nations as an activity in their school.
In 2011 [[VIBGYOR Group of Schools]] [http://www.vhmun.com Model United Nations (VHMUN)] was created. This simulation is organized by school students every year.{{cn|date=June 2018}}
In 2016, on 24, 25, 26 September. The Sri Sri Academy, in Kolkata organised its first Model United Nations Conference - SSMUN.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
In 2017, on 11 and 12 November, Symbiosis International School in Pune hosted the inaugural edition of its entirely student-organized Model UN conference, SymbiMUN. The founder and Secretary-General of the conference, Siddharth Baphna, along with his organizing team of Symbiosis students, collaborated with the education nonprofit Teach for India to train and sponsor twenty underprivileged children to participate. They donated all proceeds from the event to Teach for India, and plan to expand annually to give more underprivileged children Model UN opportunities.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
In the same year, 2017, a private Model UN conference was founded called the Backslash Model United Nations.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
In 2018, Siliguri Model United Nations is organising its inaugural conference, in collaboration with the United Nations.
In 2018 , a Model UN with a goal to help the underprivileged sections of society was founded called The Social Model United Nations (TSMUN) <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tsmun.co.in|title=TSMUN – The Social MUN|website=www.tsmun.co.in|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-08}}</ref>
In 2018, the [[Balvantray Mehta Vidya Bhawan ASMA|BMVB Model United Nations (BMVB MUN)]] conference was held in collaboration with the [[Servants of the People Society]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bmvbmun.org/home|title=BMVB Model United Nations|website=BMVB Model United Nations|language=en|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref>
==== Japan ==== [[File:KHSMUN GA.jpg|thumb|General Assembly of the Kansai High School Model United Nations at the [[Kyoto International Conference Center]], Kyoto, Japan.]] The Kansai High School Model United Nations (KHSMUN) is believed to be the first organised Model United Nations (MUN) conference aimed directly at high school [[English as a second or foreign language|English as a Foreign Language]] (EFL) students. The first conference was held in 1990 as a required project for third year students in [[Kyoto Gaidai Nishi High School]]'s Course of International and Cultural Studies. This conference included 40 KGNHS students and 13 students from [[Kansai International High School]] in [[Toyonaka, Osaka|Toyonaka]], [[Osaka Prefecture|Osaka]]. The two-day conference, held at [[Kyoto University of Foreign Studies]], simulated the Commission on Human Rights and debated the agenda item of the [[Israel]] and [[State of Palestine|Palestine]] Conflict. The conference went on to become an annual gathering of high school students studying EFL in [[Japan]]. Unlike the majority of other MUN events around the world, the Kansai High School Model United Nations is a non-competitive MUN event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.khsmun.com/2016/about.html |title=About the MUN, Kansai High School Model United Nations |publisher=KHSMUN Organising Committee |date= |accessdate=5 March 2016}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" !Year !Conference Agenda |- |2013 |Water for Life |- |2014 |Global Food Security |- |2015 |The Rights of the Child |- |2016 |Protecting the Rights of Refugees |- |2017 |Reducing Inequality Through Sustainable Development |- |2018 |The Impact of Climate Change on Children |}
====Korea====
The largest MUN conference in Korea is the Seoul Model United Nations (SEOMUN) Conference, which includes hundreds of participants from around the world. It has been held on an annual basis since 1997. The hosting responsibility rotates between three international schools in Korea: [[Korea International School (South Korea)|Korea International School]], [[Seoul International School]], and [[Seoul Foreign School]]. The conference is usually held at the [[COEX Mall|Coex Mall]] in [[Gangnam District|Gangnam District, Seoul]].

==== Taiwan ====
{{Unreferenced Section|date=May 2018}} The largest MUN conference in Taiwan is the Pan Asia MUN(PAMUN) Conference, which is held by National Taiwan University, also PAMUN is widely recognized{{By whom|date=May 2018}} as the most international MUN conference in Taiwan. There are also some regional MUN conference such as Taiwan Model United Nation (TWMUN) held by National Tsing Hua university(NTHU) and National Chiao Tung university(NCTU), Taipei Model United Nation (TMUN) held by National Chenchi University(NCCU), and Phoenix MUN held by National Cheng Kong University(NCKU). As opposed to in China, English is the usual official language of MUN in Taiwan except for some special committees which use Chinese as official language. There are also conferences for high school students in Taiwan, such as the Taiwan Model United Nation (TAIMUN) hosted by American School in Taichung, Southern Taiwan Model United Nation (STMUN) which take turns hosting by Kaohsiung American School and I-Shou International School. This trend is still booming. In 2017, the New Taipei City Model United Nations ([http://www.ntcmun.org/ NTCMUN]) was held in New Taipei City. With the resource and service of the local government, participants are allowed to attend for free; moreover it provides simultaneous interpretation equipment to help participants understand the process thoroughly. The second session of NTCMUN is about to launch in August, 2018.
====Thailand==== {{Unreferenced section|date=May 2018}}
MUN in Thailand is usually hosted by the international schools and universities in Thailand. Bangkok Patana School, Concordian International School, Ekamai International School, Harrow International School, International Seaboard Eastern School, [[NIST International School]], Chulalongkorn University and Thammasat University have all hosted Model United Nations conferences. These conferences are typically separated into university and high school levels. Model United Nations conferences are run by the school or the university club, with some guidance from their advisors. There are also conferences like ThaiMUN and APMUN, both are bigger than what the International School and university have hosted. APMUN was hosted by the Royal Thai Embassy on 20 to 24 September 2012. Unlike other Model United Nations conferences the APMUN and ThaiMUN are 3-4 day conferences, other Model United Nations conferences are usually hosted for 1 day. ThaiModel United Nations conferences are hosted by international schools or universities each year. Students from multiple international schools gather and form a host committee. The host committee decides where will ThaiMUN be hosted in that year. Thailand's MUN, unlike most Model United Nations conferences around the world, are non-competitive, and are intended to help students improve their academic and social skills .

==== New Zealand ==== A high number of New Zealand high schools operate their own MUN events, with [[UN Youth New Zealand]] functioning as a managing organisation.<ref>{{cite web|title=Leadership|url=https://www.unyouth.org.nz/about/leadership#col-md-11%20col-md-offset-1%20page-content|website=UN Youth New Zealand|publisher=UN Youth New Zealand|accessdate=7 July 2015|ref=unyouthnzleadership}}</ref> UN Youth NZ also organises regional and national events, along with Aotearoa Youth Declaration, the Pacific Project, and New Zealand's THIMUN delegation.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Hague International Model United Nations|url=http://www.unyouth.org.nz/events/thimun|website=UN Youth New Zealand|publisher=UN Youth New Zealand|accessdate=17 March 2015|ref=nzthimun|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402121800/http://www.unyouth.org.nz/events/thimun|archivedate=2 April 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== Singapore ====
{{primary sources|section|date=May 2018}} The following are Model United Nation Conferences, Model ASEAN Conferences and other model diplomatic conferences held in Singapore.
*SIMUN Singapore Model United Nations at the Singapore French School<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://lfs.edu.sg/fr/simun/index.htm |title=SIMUN at the Singapore French School |access-date=4 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161104144340/http://lfs.edu.sg/fr/simun/index.htm |archive-date=4 November 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *Raffles Model United Nations Conference<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rafflesmun.org/ |title=Raffles Model United Nations |publisher=Rafflesmun.org |date=4 June 2015 |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Dunman High Model ASEAN Plus Summit<ref>{{cite web |url=http://dhaseanplus.org/ |title=Dunman High Model ASEAN Plus Summit |publisher=Dhaseanplus.org |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160111230450/http://dhaseanplus.org/ |archivedate=11 January 2016 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *National Public School International Model United Nations<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://npsimun.com/|title=NPSiMUN|last=|first=|date=2018-05-26|website=www.npsimun.com|access-date=2018-06-29}}</ref> *Youth Model ASEAN Conference<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sp.edu.sg/ymac/index.html |title=YMAC Home |publisher=Sp.edu.sg |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Hwa Chong Conflict Resolution and Inquiry<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hccri.org/ |title=Hwa Chong Conflict Resolution and Inquiry 2015 | 16 – 17 June 2015 | A Separate Peace: Pax in Discremen |publisher=Hccri.org |date=17 June 2015 |accessdate=22 January 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20150501160542/http://hccri.org/ |archivedate=1 May 2015 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *International Model United Nations Conferences<ref name="facebook.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/internationalmodelunitednations/ |title=International Model United Nations Conference - IMUNC |publisher=Facebook.com |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Middle East Summit<ref name="facebook.com"/> *River Valley Model United Nations<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rvmun.com/ |title=rvmun2015 |publisher=Rvmun.com |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Sustainable Development Youth Convention<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nushsdyc.org/ |title=Nushsdyc.Org |publisher=Nushsdyc.Org |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Nanyang Technological University Model United Nations<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntumun.com/ |title=NTU MUN 2016 |publisher=Ntumun.com |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Singapore Chinese Girls' School Model United Nations Conference<ref>{{cite web |url=http://scmun2015.com/ |title=SCMUN | memores acti prudentes futuri |publisher=Scmun2015.com |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160109165740/http://scmun2015.com/ |archive-date=9 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *United Nations Association of Singapore Model United Nations Preparatory Conference<ref>{{cite web|url=http://prepmun.sg/unasmun/conference/ |title=UNASMUN Preparatory Conference | UNASMUN |publisher=Prepmun.sg |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Saint Joseph's Institution Model United Nations<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sjimun.com/ |title=Sjimun Homepage |website=Sjimun.com |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> *Yale-NUS Asia-Pacific Model United Nations<ref>{{cite web |url=http://yncapmun.yirpa.org/ |title=Yale-NUS Asia Pacific Model UN 2016 |publisher=Yncapmun.yirpa.org |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222133224/http://yncapmun.yirpa.org/ |archive-date=22 December 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *Victoria School Model United Nations<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vsmun2016.wix.com/vsmuniii/ |title= Victoria School Model UN 2016|publisher=vsmun2016.wix.com/vsmuniii |date= |accessdate=19 March 2016}}</ref>
'''Vietnam'''
The idea of Model United Nations is relatively new among Vietnamese youth. There has been an increasing number of such conferences, including invitational ones such as UNISMUN, SAIMUN and many other non-invitational ones. These conferences are often organised by schools or student-led organizations with varying scale and exclusivity. One of the most inclusive Model United Nations conferences in the country is Vietnam National Model United Nations (VNMUN), open to not only Vietnamese in all parts of the country but also international students studying around the world.<ref>http://ybox.vn/gia-vi/tong-hop-tat-tan-tat-cac-hoi-thao-mun-chat-luong-tai-viet-nam-he-2016-286240</ref>
=== Middle East === Model United Nations is growing in popularity in the region. The largest conference in the region held in Doha, Qatar, held each January at the Qatar National Convention Center.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://qatar.thimun.org/ |title=Qatar - Home |publisher=Qatar.thimun.org |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> THIMUN Qatar currently hosts over 1500 student participants. The region boasts over 8 THIMUN-affiliated conferences in places such as Istanbul ([http://modelundp.org MUNDP]) Jordan (AMMUN), Dubai (DIAMUN), Bahrain (BayMUN), Cairo (CIMUN and MUN MIU) and Doha (DCMUN).{{cn|date=May 2018}} Most countries in the region host numerous smaller conferences. The region also has its own regional MUN magazine, The Olive Branch, co-edited by THIMUN Qatar, THIMUN Online, and Best Delegate.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-un-middle-east/ |title=Model United Nations in the Middle East | Olive Branch Newsletter |publisher=Best Delegate |date= |accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref>
====Lebanon==== Though local MUN conferences are popular in Lebanon, it was not until 2017 that an international MUN conference had been organized making [http://www.beymun.com/ BeyMUN] (Beirut Model United Nations) the first international MUN conference held in Lebanon. In its first year, the conference drew more than 100 participants from local and international universities.{{cn|date=May 2018}} After the success of BeyMUN'16, a second edition of the conference was underwent in 21-23, April 2017.
==== UAE ==== The Indian High School Model United Nations is one of the largest Model United Nations conferences in the region. It has conducted many conferences, intra-school and international in the past.
====Israel==== Model Un has recently become popular in Israel with the organisation proMUN taking the lead to host local clubs and conferences in the country.
=== Africa ===
==== Algeria ==== Model United Nations Conference was organized for the very first time in Algeria<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://algeriamun.org/|title=AMUN 2016 {{!}} 3rd Edition|website=algeriamun.org|language=en|access-date=3 February 2017}}</ref> back in 2014 by '''[https://www.facebook.com/ARIF.moussa Mr. ARIF Abdeljalil]''', and so far it is approved to be a unique chance for Algerian youth talents to network and discuss world issues, as it offered them the opportunity to participate in an experiential education in practical global policymaking.
[https://www.facebook.com/AlgeriaMUN/ Algeria MUN]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/AlgeriaMUN/|title=Algeria Model United|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> celebrated its 3rd Annual Conference in December 2016 -Algiers- which was organized in 3 languages; English, Arabic and French. The profile of participant in this youth-based event should be between the age 16 to 29 years old, a current student, English understanding, and taking an active role in our society. {| class="wikitable" !Conference Theme !Date !Place |- |Algeria MUN Conference 1st Ever Edition: '''"Together for Algerian Youth Empowerment."''' |22, 23 and 24 December 2014. |[[Algiers]] |- |Algeria MUN Conference 2nd Edition: '''"Together for investing in the Algerian Youth."''' |27th, 28, 29 and 30 December 2015. |[[Algiers]] |- |Algeria MUN Conference 3rd Edition: '''"Youth for Peace and Development."''' |24th, 25, 26 and 27 December 2016. |[[Algiers]] |}
==== Tunisia ====
Conferences in Tunisia are mostly found in [[Tunis]] and they are usually sponsored by the Tunisian International Model United Nations (TIMUN<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timun.tn/|title=Tunisian International Model United Nations|last=|first=|date=|website=www.timun.tn/|accessdate=2012-08-01|ref=TIMUN}}</ref>). The most famous conference in Tunisia is the "Grande Simulation annuelle du TIMUN" in Tunis, which host more than 300 delegates. These conferences are usually hosted by the biggest national universities. Since the 6th edition, the "Grande Simulation annuelle" is under the patronage of the Tunisian Minister of Foreign Affairs and welcomes Tunisian ministers and diplomats.{{cn|date=May 2018}}
==== Other countries ==== The other conferences in Africa include NIAMUN<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naimun.org|title=North Africa International Model United Nations|last=|first=|date=|website=www.naimun.org|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150616110200/http://naimun.org/|archive-date=2015-06-16|dead-url=yes|accessdate=2012-08-01|ref=NAIMUN}}</ref> in [[Marrakech]]. Established in August 2012 by a coalition of North African youths, NAIMUN is the largest student-run Model United Nations conference in Africa and the Middle East, with 4 sub-branches in Morocco, Tunisia, Algeria and Egypt. It trains and encourages young people to address pressing global issues and engages them in resolving global problems. NAIMUN is a non-profit organization which provides an equal opportunity for all youth to actively participate in an open debate. JoMUN<ref>{{cite web|title=Johannesburg Model United Nations|url=https://mymun.net/muns/jomun-2015|website=JoMUN on MyMUN.net|accessdate=1 June 2015|ref=naimun}}</ref> in [[Johannesburg]], and the recently founded IMIRAMUN<ref>{{cite web|title=International Mirabilis Model United Nations|url=https://mymun.net/muns/imiramun-2015|website=IMIRAMUN on MyMUN.net|accessdate=1 June 2015|ref=naimun}}</ref> in [[Windhoek]] took place in Benin, in Cotonou. The first edition of Algeria Model United Nations was held in December 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Algeria Model United Nations |url=http://algeriamun.org/|ref=AlgeriaMUN|website=Algeriamun.org|accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> The East African Model United Nations ([http://www.eamun.org EAMUN]) takes place in Nairobi, Kenya. Also mentionable is the recently conducted Lagos Model United Nations held at the University of Lagos in Nigeria, the first of its kind in West Africa. The conference first held in 2016 and is hoped to be an annual occurrence. The idea was made reality by Nigerian Students of the Faculty of Law of the aforementioned University after several experiences of the National MUN especially winning many awards.
=== South America ===
====Brazil====
'''''AMUN'''''
The Americas Model United Nations (AMUN<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://amun.org.br/|title=AMUN|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140516193407/http://amun.org.br/|archive-date=16 May 2014|dead-url=yes|access-date=2018-06-29|df=dmy-all}}</ref> ) was the first MUN Conference to be held in Latin America, accomplishing 21 years of history in 2018 with the edition ''Bring Walls Down, Build Up Connections''. The event official language is English, which has enabled AMUN to receive students from various countries worldwide. The Model seeks to get as close as possible to the reality of a multilateral diplomatic forum, including its specific rules and procedures. The committees vary with each edition of the project, as well as its themes addressed, among which are international security, cooperation, human rights, democracy and transnational crimes. The event lasts five days and extrapolates the academic sphere, allowing interpersonal experiences and cultural activities. Among the cultural activities, there is a tour around Brasília, the city hosting the event, and the Nations Fair, in which the peculiarities and customs of each country are shown by the participants representing them on the Conference.
'''''BRAMUN''''' - BRAMUN - is a conference that occurs yearly in March and is designed for high school students from different countries in South America. The conference happens at Costa do Sauípe in Bahia, Brazil and will be heading to its seventeenth edition in 2019. BRAMUN 2019 will have ten committees: five "normal" committees among which are included the Security Council, Historic Security Council, the Political Committee, ECOSOC and the Human Rights Council and five special committees. Some examples of special committees will be the Crisis Cabinet of the Spanish Popular Front, the International Court of Justice, the Cabinets of Kruschev and Eisenhower which will have a joint topic and a committee to discuss BREXIT negotiations from the point of view of the nations of the EU. BRAMUN also has activities for delegates to participate when they are not participating in their respective committees. These activities make part of the BRAMUN Cup, which in the past has included football, basketball, volleyball, knowledge bowl, Mr. and Ms. BRAMUN, a treasure hunt and a Delegate Luau.
'''''SMUN''''' - The Swiss Model United Nations - is an annual conference strictly for high school students. The conference is held by [https://chpr.aesb.com.br/ Colégio Suíço-brasileiro de Curitiba], hence the "Swiss" name. Each year, the conference is reinvented, 2016's edition had committees such as the Commission on Narcotic Drugs and the Scientific and Technological Subcommittee of COPUOS (Committee On the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space), whereas the 2017 conference was entirely composed of crisis committees with a special committee called the Crisis Directorate Committee, specifically made to design and develop crisis. International high schools are invited every year to participate however, schools can also volunteer to participate.
'''''FAMUN''''' - FACAMP Model United Nations – is a model annually organized by [http://international.facamp.com.br/ ''FACAMP''] – Faculdades de Campinas, located in the city of Campinas, São Paulo, Brazil.<br /> It is a multidisciplinary initiative with the objective of simulating different international organizations, especially the ones under the [https://www.un.org/ ''United Nations''] organisational umbrella.<br /> Over 5 days, approximately 500 high school and college students from different Brazilian cities discuss issues of great international relevance by performing the role as Heads of State and Government, Ministers and Diplomats.<br /> The organization of FAMUN follows the orientation of the [https://outreach.un.org/mun/ ''UN4MUN''] approach: developed by the United Nations Department of Public Information, the approach proposes to bring MUNs’ practice closer to the real procedures of the United Nations. The result is a focus on debate that captures the spirit of cooperation and the process of reaching consensus.<ref>FAMUN 2016. [http://www.famun.com.br/2016/es/home-pagepresentation/ ''Presentation'']. Retrieved on 7 March 2017.</ref>
==== Peru ====
{{Unreferenced section|date=April 2018}} [[File:Peruvian Universities.jpg|thumb|[[Peruvian Universities Debate Team|Peruvian Universities]], Best Large Delegation at WorldMUN 2014.]] At university level, Model United Nations started in Peru in 2006 with the United Nations Studies Circle (CENU), a college team from the [[University of Lima]] founded to compete at [[Harvard National Model United Nations]]. This team would evolution into a full-scale organization, the Peruvian Association for the Study of the United Nations (AENU Peru for its Spanish acronym), a non-for-profit NGO charged with task of promoting MUN in Peru and creating Peru's first "National Delegation", using past experience to select the finest delegates from Peru's finest universities, thus creating the [[Peruvian Universities Debate Team]] (PU). Starting their new trademark since 2011, PU's has garnered the Best Large Delegation award at [[Harvard World Model United Nations]] 2014 held in Brussels, Belgium, and the Best Large Delegation award at [[Harvard International Relations Council|Harvard National Model United Nations - Latin America]] 2017, held in Lima, Peru. [[File:PDS.jpg|thumb|[[Peruvian Debate Society]], Best Large Delegation at WorldMUN 2018.]] In 2014, [[Peruvian Debate Society]] was founded by experienced MUN delegates as a new alternative towards competing in [[Harvard International Relations Council]] conferences. Starting their full-scale performance in 2015, PDS's has achieved the Best Large Delegation award at [[Harvard International Relations Council|Harvard National Model United Nations - Latin America]] in three editions out of four participations. Recently, the team became the second Peruvian delegation to win the Best Large Delegation award at [[Harvard World Model United Nations]] 2018, held in Panama City, Panama.
At high school level, MUN has been a popular extracurricular activity since 2012, with the first high school conference Lima Model United Nations (LiMUN) 2012, followed by Villa Maria Model United Nations (VMMUN) 2015, Newton Model United Nations (NewMUN) 2015, and Carmelitas Model United Nations 2015, being the latter school the host for the first Ivy League Model United Nations Conference Peru (ILMUNC 2016). Each school delegation hosts its own conference, transcending from the capital city of Lima to Cusco, Arequipa and Piura.
In 2015, the [[Promotora International de Debates - Perú]] (PRIDE Peru) was founded as an NGO towards the projection of creating the first Inter-school Delegation, United Schools of Peru, in order to compete internationally. The team has garnered twice the Best International Delegation award at the Ivy League Model United Nations Conference (2016 & 2018), and at the WFUNA International Model United Nations (WIMUN 2017 & 2018).

revision.text:
'''Model United Nations in the United States''' is a popular [[extracurricular activity]] for [[middle school]], [[high school]], and [[college]] students.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/04/education/edlife/a-new-student-run-breed-crisis-oriented-and-fiercely-competitive.html|title=The Dog-Eat-Dog World of Model U.N.|date=4 August 2013|work=The New York Times|accessdate=22 January 2016}}</ref> The [[United States]] was where [[Model United Nations]] originated and was popularized,<ref>{{cite web|author=<!-- Share --> |url=http://montessori-mun.org/faq-mmun-program/ |title=FAQ - The MMUN Program - Montessori Model United Nations |publisher=Montessori-mun.org |date=2015-11-03 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> and is also where many of the world's most respected conferences are held.<ref name="bestdelegate1">{{cite web|url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-un-conferences-database/ |title=High School Conference Database: 2015-2016 |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2015-12-13 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> The U.S. has several regional centers of Model UN, each with its own distinct style.<ref name="bestdelegate2">{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/the-150-best-high-school-model-un-teams-in-north-america-2013-2014/ |title=The 150 Best High School Model UN Teams in North America 2013-2014 |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2014-06-17 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
Traditionally, Model UN has been associated with affluent schools and communities, but in recent years, the activity has expanded to reach more students.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/10/12/model-un-program-inspires-underprivileged-kids_n_1008024.html |title=Model UN Program Inspires Underprivileged Kids |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
== Model UN by Region == Model United Nations is popular across the United States, with MUN clubs and conferences being found in every region.<ref name="bestdelegate1"/> However, because of the fact that Model UN is decentralized and has grown autonomously, there are significant differences in how MUN is done between regions.<ref name="bestdelegate3">{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/a-tale-of-two-coasts-5-key-differences-between-west-coast-versus-east-coast-model-un/ |title=A Tale of Two Coasts: 5 Key Differences Between West Coast versus East Coast Model UN |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-03-06 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
=== East Coast === Centered on the [[New York metropolitan area|New York]] and [[Washington metropolitan area]]s, both of which play host to a multitude of prestigious, largely university-hosted conferences, including those of [[Georgetown University]] ([[Georgetown International Relations Association]]) and [[George Washington University]]. Other conferences in the region include HMUN, hosted by Harvard, [http://www.jhumunc.org/ JHUMUNC] hosted at [[Johns Hopkins University]] in [[Baltimore]], and NMUN, hosted in New York City.<ref>{{cite web|author=kbonn |url=http://bestdelegate.com/2014-2015-north-american-college-model-un-final-rankings/ |title=2014-2015 North American College Model UN Final Rankings |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2015-05-27 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> The [[Northeastern United States|Northeast]] has established a reputation for approaching Model United Nations with an idealistic philosophy, while still emphasizing the academic competition aspect of Model UN and giving awards for delegates. Conferences also evaluate delegates holistically when deciding on the distribution of awards. Crisis committees are especially popular in the Northeast, and lead to this region's conferences having more of a focus on creativity.<ref name="bestdelegate3"/>
=== West Coast === The [[West Coast of the United States|West Coast]] is known for their Model United Nations programs. Naturally stressing the academic side of Model UN, conferences greatly value well-written position papers, not just factoring them into awards decisions, but also giving dedicated awards for them. The popularity of Model United Nations, as well as for the high quality of delegates.<ref name="bestdelegate3"/> West Coast conferences are run by universities, high schools, and interscholastic organizations. [http://bmun.org/ BMUN (Berkeley MUN)], [http://mckennamun.org/ McKennaMUN], and [http://scmun.org/ SCMUN] are popular college conferences for high school delegates. For example, SCMUN (hosted by the University of Southern California), offers advanced debate for high school delegates who are hoping to glean substantive and academic value from Model United Nations conferences. Additionally, high school-run conferences such as Huntington Beach High School's Surf City and Novice Conferences, [http://www.cerritosmun.com/ CHSMUN], and Mira Costa's LAIMUN are all nationally-recognized conferences.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Final 2012-2013 High School Rankings|url = http://bestdelegate.com/final-2012-2013-high-school-rankings/|website = Best Delegate|access-date = 2016-02-13}}</ref>
=== Midwest === Despite the fact that the [[Midwestern United States|Midwest]] has fewer conferences than the more established East and West Coast circuits,<ref name="bestdelegate4">{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-united-nations-of-the-university-of-chicago-munuc-liveblog-educating-the-midwest/ |title=Model United Nations of the University of Chicago (MUNUC) Liveblog: Educating the Midwest |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-02-05 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> it still has a very developed and distinct Model UN culture that is dominated by small regional conferences (such as Midwest Model UN (MMUN), Model UN at the University of Illinois (MUNI), and large international-level conferences centered around Chicago). While some major conferences are located in [[Michigan]] and [[Missouri]],<ref>{{cite web|author=Ryan |url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-united-nations-at-the-university-of-michigan-munum-2013/ |title=Model United Nations at the University of Michigan (MUNUM) 2013 |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2013-01-20 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> most are located in [[Illinois]],<ref name="bestdelegate5">{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/high-school-preseason-rankings/ |title=High School Model UN Preseason Rankings |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2011-09-20 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> specifically in [[Chicago]].
Chicago is a major hub of the Model UN community at large, but maintains a strong sense of independence, and is known to have a characteristic focus on realism and innovative crisis simulations.<ref>{{cite web|author=Emily |url=http://bestdelegate.com/5-things-to-know-about-midwestern-model-un/ |title=5 Things to Know About Midwestern Model UN |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-04-27 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> MUN is mostly seen as an educational political exercise, where the students understanding of the world and power is emphasized, and where awards and resolution writing tend to be de-emphasized.<ref name="bestdelegate4"/><ref name="bestdelegate6">{{cite web|author=Ryan |url=http://bestdelegate.com/chicago-international-model-united-nations-conference-cimun-2012/ |title=Politics, Business, and Technology: 3 Takeaways from the Chicago International Model United Nations Conference (CIMUN) |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-12-19 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> As a result, the Midwest's crisis conferences are well-regarded, with ChoMUN and CIMUN being particularly well known for this style.<ref name="bestdelegate6"/><ref name="bestdelegate7">{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/chicago-model-united-nations-chomun-2012-solving-the-worlds-crises/ |title=Chicago Model United Nations (ChoMUN) 2012: Solving the World’s Crises |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-04-09 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
[[Model United Nations of the University of Chicago (MUNUC)]] is the largest high school conference in the Midwest, featuring 27 different committees, with several thousand delegates in attendance.<ref name="bestdelegate4"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://munuc.org/ |title=Model United Nations of the University of Chicago |publisher=Munuc.org |date= |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> The Model United Nations Development Organization (MUNDO) <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.modelun.net|title=Welcome to MUNDO! {{!}} Model United Nations Development Organization (MUNDO)|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|accessdate=October 12, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130209055313/http://www.modelun.net/|archivedate=February 9, 2013}}</ref> runs the [[Chicago International Model United Nations (CIMUN)]], which featured 24 committees, and welcomed 1300 high school delegates in 2014, its 11th annual conference. CIMUN is known to be among the most innovative and fastest growing Model UN's in the US and features some of the most realistic simulations available for high school students.<ref name="bestdelegate6"/><ref>{{cite web|author=Bill Kosmidis |url=http://bestdelegate.com/conference-recap-a-delegates-perspective-on-cimun-chicago-international-model-united-nations-conference/ |title=Conference Recap: A Delegate’s Perspective on CIMUN (Chicago International Model United Nations Conference) |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2014-12-30 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
The Chicago Model United Nations (ChoMUN), also organized by the University of Chicago, is a prestigious college-level Model UN conference in the region, being well known for its unique simulations, and is known to be one of the best college-level crisis conferences in the US.<ref name="bestdelegate7"/> The American Model United Nations (AMUN), an independent organization, is the largest college-level conference in the Midwest and featured 15 committees. In 2014, AMUN welcomed 1400 delegates from around the US and the globe,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amun.org/about-amun/ |title=About AMUN | American Model United Nations |publisher=Amun.org |date= |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> and also celebrated its 25th anniversary.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amun.org/uploads/2014_Conference_Program_lowres.pdf |format=PDF |title=American Model United Nations International : 2014 Conference Program |website=Amun.org |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>
In recent years, more Midwestern teams have also traveled to conferences on the East Coast, raising their profile nationally. High schools, such as the [[University of Chicago Laboratory Schools]], [[St. Ignatius College Prep]], [[Lyons Township High School]], [[Glenbrook South High School]], and [[Carl Sandburg High School]] have performed well at large East Coast conferences and have become particularly well-known.<ref name="bestdelegate2"/><ref name="bestdelegate5"/><ref>{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/final-2012-2013-high-school-rankings/ |title=Final 2012-2013 High School Rankings |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2013-05-29 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> University teams have also been successful, such as UChicago's team which in both 2013 and 2014 was ranked the best college Model UN team in North America, the first team to twice achieve this feat.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bestdelegate.com/model-un-rankings/ |title=Rankings |publisher=Best Delegate |date= |accessdate=2016-01-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160126014202/http://bestdelegate.com/model-un-rankings/ |archivedate=2016-01-26 |df= }}</ref> Other teams like <ref>{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/hnmun-and-mcmun-tie-as-best-north-american-conference-of-2013-2014/ |title=HNMUN and McMUN Tie as Best North American Conference of 2013-2014 |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2014-05-21 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> Alma College, UW Oshkosh and University of Illinois - Chicago have made a name for themselves at larger conferences like National Model UN (NMUN) and American Model UN (AMUN), and at regional conferences like Midwest Model UN (MMUN).
In addition to the city of Chicago, several Minnesota teams have become major players in conferences around the country. In the 2010-2011 season, Cambridge-Isanti finished the year ranked 14th in the best delegate national rankings after finishing the equivalent of second at MUNUC and winning awards at UMMUC. Edina High School hosts the only student run conference in Minnesota, often attracting up to four hundred high school delegates from over twelve metropolitan schools. Edina High School and Cambridge-Isanti High School are still ranked in the top 150 high school programs in the country by Best Delegate. Other notable Minnesota teams include Minnetonka High School and the Blake School.
=== South === Middle school Model UN is fairly popular in the South.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bestdelegate.com/top-12-scheduling-and-market-trends-from-the-2011-12-model-un-conference-calendar/ |title=Top 12 Model UN Conference Scheduling and Market Trends in 2011-12 |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2011-05-05 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> The vibrant South region of Model UN in the U.S. can be easily divided into three sub-regions, San Antonio, Texas, Southwest Florida,<ref>{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/southwest-florida-model-un-powerhouse/ |title=How Southwest Florida High Schools Have Become National Powerhouses in Model UN |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-04-26 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref> and Virginia. All excel at Model UN and have distinct styles.
=== Puerto Rico === In [[Puerto Rico]], students are [[multilingualism|bilingual]] and speeches in committee are therefore allowed to be made in either [[English language|English]] or [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. It should be noted however that Spanish is used slightly more often.
The speaking style of Puerto Rican Model UN delegates tends to be more animated than that of other delegates.{{Citation needed|date=February 2016}} Students often speak louder and faster, and when delivering speeches, they may pace in front of their committee instead of standing still.
After a speech, if a delegate wishes to ask a question of the speaker they must ask “Delegates, will you accept my question?” before being able to address the speaker. This is a practice isolated to Puerto Rico, and delegates may be penalized by their chairs if they fail to adhere to it.
Chairs in Puerto Rico adopt a more activist approach, directing the flow of debate and banging their gavels often. This is in comparison to the facilitator style of chairing more common in the rest of the United States which allows delegates to direct more of the flow of debate.
Parents in Puerto Rico are highly supportive of Model UN and some are even [[alumni]]. It is not uncommon for parents to volunteer to help at conferences, and many are present at closing ceremonies.<ref>{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/the-only-formal-circuit-in-the-world-structural-and-cultural-lessons-from-la-federacion-in-puerto-rico/ |title=The Only Formal Circuit in the World: Structural and Cultural Lessons from La Federación in Puerto Rico |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-10-15 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=KFC |url=http://bestdelegate.com/puerto-rico-lo-hace-mejor-how-model-un-is-part-of-the-culture-and-why-puerto-ricans-do-it-better/ |title=Puerto Rico Lo Hace Mejor: How Model UN is Part of the Culture and Why Puerto Ricans Do It Better |publisher=Best Delegate |date=2012-03-07 |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Nikita |url=http://bestdelegate.com/crisis-simulations-a-puerto-rican-perspective/ |title=Crisis Simulations- A Puerto Rican Perspective |publisher=Best Delegate |date= |accessdate=2016-01-22}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use British English|date=August 2012}}
'''The North of England Education Conference (NEEC)''' was the UK’s biggest annual education conference. The first Conference took place in [[Manchester]] in 1903.<ref>[http://openlibrary.org/b/OL20289314M/North_of_England_education_conference_1902-1992 "A history of the NEEC Conference 1902 -1992"] Professor Peter Osgood, Leeds University Press</ref> The event provided an opportunity for senior decision makers in education, Children’s Services, the public sector, associated agencies and organisations to meet and consider the latest thinking and legislation affecting children and young people. In recent years the scope of the conference had expanded to encompass the broader children’s services agenda.
Despite the conference name, delegates attended from across the UK and beyond. In recent years the conference took place outside of the North of England, including [[Belfast]] and [[Cardiff]]. In 2015 the conference was to be hosted in [http://www.educationconferences.co.uk Manchester] between 14–16 January but was cancelled and has not been held since. ==Delegates==
Within recent years the focus of the conference had expanded. Whilst still having education at its core, a broader children’s agenda was embraced. Attendees included Directors of Education, key elected members, headteachers, school governors, those engaged in research in Higher Education and partners from Health, Police and Voluntary Sector organisations.
==Speakers==
The conference attracted high-profile speakers and notably the appropriate Secretary of State. This has included in recent years [[Ed Balls]], [[Ruth Kelly]], [[David Miliband]], [[David Blunkett]] and [[Estelle Morris]]. The conference was often used as a platform to launch or 'sound out' changes in policy or legislation. Hosting authorities often worked in collaboration with local universities and colleges to tap into national and international expertise and research.
==Venues==
Historically the Conference has taken place each January and has alternated in venue between the east and west of the [[Pennines]]. On occasion however, the Conference has been held outside the North of England. In 2004 the NEEC was held in [[Northern Ireland]] in [[Belfast]] and in 2008, the NEEC paid its first visit to [[Wales]] and [[Cardiff]]. In January 2014 the last conference was held in [[Nottingham]].
==Development==
Reflecting changes in recent years in the delivery of services to children, young people and families the conference focus had begun to reflect the wider children’s agenda encapsulated in ''[[Every Child Matters|Every Child Matters: Change for Children]]''.<ref>[http://www.dcsf.gov.uk/everychildmatters/ "Every Child Matters Agenda"] {{webarchive|url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20101220152656/http://www.dcsf.gov.uk/everychildmatters/ |date=20 December 2010 }} Labour Government Paper enshrining the Children Act 2004 (retrieved 31 July 2010)</ref> Whilst the conference continued to provide high-profile speakers with an education focus, it had recently included speakers from other areas of the children’s workforce such as health, the police, business and the [[Voluntary sector|Third Sector]]. However the event, which generations of education policymakers viewed as a key moment of the year, now appears to be a thing of the past and by the time Michael Gove took over as education secretary in 2010, it was an event he was quite happy to miss, choosing to make major announcements elsewhere. No minister was due to appear in 2015.
==Governance==
The NEEC operated under the governance formed by its membership as part of the North of England Education Conference Association. This is defined as ''"Those English Local Authorities within the Government Office areas for the North West, the North East and Yorkshire and the Humber, and also the higher education institutions lying in this area".'' Representatives from the host authority, their predecessor and the following years host were represented in the governance.
==Involvement of children and young people==
A strong feature of the conference is the involvement of children and young people. Traditionally involved in artistic, musical and dramatic performance they had begun to play a wider role in the content of the programme. In January 2012 Blackpool had a young person co-preside over the conference for the first time along with President, [[Ann Widdecombe]]. In [[Nottingham]] in 2014 there was a separate Youth Conference running alongside the main event run by young people from the eight Core Cities.
==History of the Conference==
In 1902, having seen the success of a conference for science teachers in London, JH Reynolds, Manchester City Council's Director of Technical Instruction, decided to replicate the conference in his home town. The conference, also with a science theme, was arranged for 2 and 3 January 1903 and attended by 3,200 teachers, lecturers, inspectors and local government employees.<ref>[http://www.tes.co.uk/article.aspx?storycode=373229 "Best wishes to our friend in the North"] Times Educational Supplement, 3 January 2003, Alison Brace - Article on the History of the NEEC on its 100th anniversary (retrieved 31 July 2010)</ref> Built on this success the conference widened the agenda to cover all areas of the curriculum. With short input from a range of professionals the, conference has remained true to the original template and remained a fixture in the first week of the year.
In 1924 the political dimension was added and the Secretary of the State of the day has usually been in attendance ever since, the conference often serving as a platform for announcement to changes in legislation or educational approaches. Over the course of its history this has included: [[Anthony Crosland]], [[Kenneth Baker, Baron Baker of Dorking|Kenneth Baker]], [[Kenneth Clarke]], [[Shirley Williams]] and [[Margaret Thatcher]].<ref>[http://www.margaretthatcher.org/speeches/displaydocument.asp?docid=102083 "Speech to North of England Education Conference"], 6 Jan 1971, Margaret Thatcher</ref> Kenneth Clarke, on assuming his post as Secretary of State, is reported to have been told it was the one conference he could not afford to miss.
==2004-2014==
===2004: The five Northern Ireland Education and Libraries Boards in Belfast=== The Conference in Belfast was attended by almost 1,000 delegates and was considered one of the most successful NEECs; (the typical attendance in England is 500 delegates). Amongst the speakers was [[David Miliband|David Miliband MP]] who gave a speech on Personalised Learning.
===2005 Manchester=== The Centre for Educational Leadership at [[The University of Manchester]] hosted the Conference in 2005. The conference included the first public speech by the new Secretary of State for Education and Skills, [[Ruth Kelly]], appointed just three weeks earlier following [[Charles Clarke]]'s promotion to Home Secretary. The theme was 'Leading Together' and the aim, to demonstrate how schools, Higher Education and Local Authorities could collaborate to develop leadership potential and to lead education improvement. Speakers included [[Benjamin Zander]], Conductor of the Boston Philharmonic and [[Peter Senge|Dr Peter Senge]], author of '[[The Fifth Discipline|The Fifth Discipline: The Art and Practice of The Learning Organisation]]'.
===2006 Gateshead and Newcastle Councils=== The 2006 North of England Education Conference was held in [[Gateshead]] and consisted of three days of speakers, workshops and receptions. Speakers included [[Jane Davidson|Jane Davidson AM]], the Minister for Education and Lifelong Learning, [[Ruth Kelly|Ruth Kelly MP]]<ref>[http://www.gateshead.gov.uk/Council%20and%20Democracy/news/News%20Articles/Education%20Secretary%20Ruth%20Kelly%20speaks%20at%20Gateshead%20conference(1).aspx "Education Secretary Ruth Kelly speaks at Gateshead Conference"] Gateshead Council, 16 December 2005</ref> the Secretary of State for Education, Professor Al Aynsley-Green, the [[Children’s Commissioner for England]] and Dr Michael Fullan, the former Dean of the Ontario Institute for Studies for Education. There was also a formal Civic Reception and a Gala Dinner.
===2007 Lancashire County Council=== The Conference took place from 3–5 January 2007 at the Guildhall, [[Preston, Lancashire|Preston]] in [[Lancashire]] with the theme of ‘Investing for Achievement’. Jonathan Jansen, University of Pretoria, South Africa; [[Jude Kelly]], Artistic Director, South Bank Centre and Leader of the 2012 Olympics Education and Culture Programme; Juan Manuel Moreno, Senior Education Specialist, The World Bank. The ministerial Address was given by [[Jim Knight|Jim Knight MP]], Minister of State for Schools and 14 - 19 Learners
===2008 The Welsh Assembly and Welsh LGA=== In January 2008 the NEEC once again left the North West and was held in the Wales Millennium Centre in Cardiff Bay, with workshops being hosted in various locations across the city and beyond.
The programme include presentations from Professor John Field from the University of Stirling and Professor David Hopkins from the Institute of Education at London University. In addition there were speeches from the journalist [[Fiona Millar]] and the former General Secretary of the Transport and General Workers Union, [[Bill Morris, Baron Morris of Handsworth]]. A civic reception was held in the [[Senedd|Senedd Building]]; the home of the National Assembly hosted by the First Minister [[Rhodri Morgan|Rhodri Morgan AM]].
===2009 Wirral CC and Chester City Council=== The theme for the conference held in [[Metropolitan Borough of Wirral|Wirral]] and [[Chester]] was ‘Growing People – Growing Minds’. The conference was notable in its embracing the wider children’s workforce in the programme. The conference president was [[Estelle Morris|Baroness Estelle Morris]] and speakers included [[Peter Fahy]], Chief Contable Greater Manchester, Liz Railton CBE, Professor Sir David Watson, [[Gillian Pugh|Dame Gillian Pugh]], and with the new broader emphasis Dr David Colin Thomé giving a GPs perspective. The conference included the traditional political spot with input from [[David Willetts|David Willetts MP]] and Secretary of State [[Ed Balls]] who attended following a Cabinet Meeting in [[Liverpool]]. All schools in Wirral were involved in a ‘Performance Extravaganza’ held throughout Weather Head High School Media College.
===2010 City of York Council=== The theme for [[York|York’s]] conference was ‘Unlocking Children’s Potential’ and had [[Michael Bichard|Sir Michael Bichard]] as conference president. Speakers included [[Roger Singleton|Sir Roger Singleton]], Sir John Sorrell, [[Andrew Motion|Sir Andrew Motion]], Dylan Wiliam and [[Beeban Kidron]], British Television and Film Director. The political slot was filled by [[Vernon Coaker|Vernon Coaker MP]], [[Michael Gove|Michael Gove MP]] and [[David Laws|David Laws MP]]. An input by York’s Member of the [[UK Youth Parliament]] was well received by delegates. Delegates attended a civic reception at [[York Minster]] with a performance by a large children’s choir. The gala dinner made innovative use of the [[York Railway Museum]]. The conference in York went ahead successfully despite falling during a period of heavy snow which caused transport problems nationally for a number of days.
===2011 Blackpool Council=== The theme for Blackpool’s conference theme was ‘Our World, Our Future’. The conference continued the development of previous events in opening the theme out to include aspects of the wider Children’s Services agenda.
The conference presidency was shared between [[Ann Widdecombe]] and a young person from the town. Conference speakers included [[Nick Gibb|Nick Gibb MP]],<ref>[http://www.education.gov.uk/inthenews/speeches/a0072204/nick-gibb-to-the-north-of-england-education-conference "Nick Gibb to the North of England Education Conference"] DofE, 11 January 2011</ref> [[Andy Burnham|Andy Burnham MP]], [[Martin Bell]], [[Estelle Morris|Baroness Estelle Morris]], [[Children's Commissioner for England|Dr Margaret Atkinson]],<ref>[http://www.childrenscommissioner.gov.uk/content/blog/content_364 "Young people shine at Blackpool education conference"] Children’s Commissioner for England Blog, 7 January 2011</ref> [[Paul Ennals|Sir Paul Ennals]], [[National College for School Leadership|Steve Munby]], Sharon Shoesmith,<ref>[http://www.cypnow.co.uk/Archive/1048283/Budget-cuts-put-children-risk-says-Shoesmith/ "Budget cuts put children at risk, says Shoesmith"] Children and Young People Now, 7 January 2011</ref> [[Ian Kennedy (lawyer)|Sir Ian Kennedy]], Saul Nasse, Professor Barry Carpenter, [[Charles Pollard (police officer)|Sir Charles Pollard]] and [[Tanni Grey-Thompson, Baroness Grey-Thompson|Tanni Grey-Thompson]]. The conference took place between the neighbouring hotels Blackpool Hilton and The Imperial. The Gala Dinner was hosted in the [[Blackpool Tower Ballroom]] and featured dancing, circus skills and a performance on the world-famous Wurlitzer.
===2012 Leeds City Council=== [[Leeds]] City Council hosted the NEEC from 4–6 January 2012 under the title of, "Passion, Potential, Performance". Mick Waters, former Director of Curriculum at the Qualifications and Curriculum Authority was the conference president. The venue for the event was the [[Royal Armouries Museum]].
===2013 Sheffield=== The theme for Sheffield’s Conference was Mind, Brain, Community, Inspiring: Learners, Strengthening Resilience. The Conference was hosted by [[Sheffield City Council]], the [[University of Sheffield]] and [[Sheffield Hallam University]]. The Right Honorable [[David Blunkett]] MP was the President. Conference speakers included: Dr. Isaac Prilleltensky, Professor Steven P R Rose, Professor Philip Davis, Marlo Winstead, Baroness Campbell, Professor Kenneth Gergen, Professor Barry Carpenter, [[Sir Michael Wilshaw]] [[HMCI]], [[Elizabeth Truss]] MP, Professor the Lord [[Robert Winston]], Dr Steven Edwards, Jean Gross Professor Tanya Byron, [[Camila Batmanghelidjh]], Matthew Syed, [[Lord Baker of Dorking]] and Charlie Taylor,
The Gala Event, ‘An Evening of Conversation’ was held in the Millennium Galleries & Winter Gardens, providing an opportunity for delegates to continue their conversations with the conference contributors, and included food and entertainment. The conference took place at Sheffield Hallam University.
===NEEC 2014 Nottingham City Council===
[http://www.nottinghamcity.gov.uk/ Nottingham City Council] hosted the [https://registration.livegroup.co.uk/neec2014/ 2014 NEEC]. It took place from 15–17 January 2014 at [[Nottingham Conference Centre]]. The 2014 conference was entitled 'Education: Innovation, Creativity, Employability'.
Speakers included [[David Puttnam]], [[Charles Leadbeater]], [[David Laws|David Laws MP]], [[Tristram Hunt|Tristram Hunt MP]], [[Matthew Hancock|Matthew Hancock MP]], [[Sir Michael Wilshaw]] and [[Children's Commissioner for England|Dr Maggie Atkinson]].
